page.title: 10LONGNOR VILLAGE.
page.content: Longnor is a tiny village set in the typical Staffordshire countryside. It has 28 people living in it with a total of 9 houses.We spoke to Mrs.Hoole who has lived there for 31 years.She likes it a lot and the villagers call it a Hamlet. There are no shops in the village so they travel into larger villages or towns to do their shopping. The milk is delivered by the man from Wheaton Aston.The postman travels from Penkridge.Out of the nine cottages five are old farm cottages. A stream passes through Longnor under a tiny hump backed bridge.The stream is called'The LONGNOR brook'. This village is worth a visit as the countryside around it is very pretty.
